org.lenskit.config

Class BindingDSL

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.grouplens.grapht.AbstractContext
      • org.lenskit.inject.AbstractConfigContext
        • org.lenskit.config.BindingDSL
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Context, LenskitConfigContext
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    LenskitConfigDSL

    public class BindingDSL
extends AbstractConfigContext

    Groovy DSL definition for configuring LensKit recommenders. This class is the base class of configuration scripts and the delegate against which configuration blocks are run.

    The fact that this extends AbstractConfigContext is basically an implementation detail, to make sure that we always provide proxies for all the methods.

    Since:
    1.2

        public void include(URI uri)
             throws IOException,
                    RecommenderConfigurationException

        Include another configuration file.

        Parameters:
        uri - The URI of the configuration file.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an error is thrown loading the script.
        RecommenderConfigurationException - if there is an error running the script.
        UnsupportedOperationException - if the current context does not support loading.

        public Binding set(@Nonnull
                   Class<? extends Annotation> param)
        Description copied from interface: LenskitConfigContext

        Start a binding that sets a parameter. Parameters are qualifiers that bear the Parameter annotation.

        Specified by:
        set in interface LenskitConfigContext
        Overrides:
        set in class AbstractConfigContext
        Parameters:
        param - The parameter to set.
        Returns:
        The binding for this parameter. It is untyped, as many types will be accepted and attempted.
        See Also:
        LenskitConfigContext.set(Class)

      • addComponent

        public void addComponent(@Nonnull
                         Object obj)
        Description copied from interface: LenskitConfigContext

        Add a component object to the injector. This is the equivalent of: 

        
this.bind(obj.getClass()).to(obj);

        It has the result of making obj available satisfy dependencies on its class or, via supertype binding generation, any of its supertypes. Explicit bindings for those supertypes will override this binding.

        Specified by:
        addComponent in interface LenskitConfigContext
        Overrides:
        addComponent in class AbstractConfigContext
        Parameters:
        obj - The object to register.

      • within

        public LenskitConfigContext within(Class<?> type,
                                   groovy.lang.Closure<?> block)

        Enclose a block of configuration in a context. The block is invoked with a delegate that adds bindings within the specified context.

        Parameters:
        type - The type to match for the context.
        block - The configuration block.
        Returns:
        The configuration context.
        See Also:
        LenskitConfigContext.within(Class)

      • domain

        public PreferenceDomain domain(Map<String,Object> args)

        Make and bind a preference domain. With this method, this: 

          domain minimum: 1, maximum: 5

        is equivalent to: 

          bind PreferenceDomain to prefDomain(minimum: 1, maximum: 5)

        Parameters:
        args - The arguments.
        Returns:
        The preference domain.
        See Also:
        prefDomain(java.util.Map)

      • prefDomain

        public PreferenceDomain prefDomain(Map<String,Object> args)

        Make a preference domain. This method takes three named arguments:

        minimum
        The minimum rating
        maximum
        The maximum rating
        precision (optional)
        The preference precision.

        Parameters:
        args - The arguments.
        Returns:
        The preference domain.
        See Also:
        PreferenceDomain
